description: The Autocomplete component can be wrapped around any form of input to get an flexible starting point to provide an real-time autocomplete dropdown. We use it for our `TagsInput` component.

props.name: html
props.description: If set to `true`, the text of the options is rendered as HTML

props.name: skip
props.description: You can pass an array of strings, which should be ignored in the search.

props.name: options
props.description:
Options for the autocomplete dropdown must be passed as an array of
objects. Each object can have as many items as you like, but a text
item is required to match agains the query

example.description: [ { text: "this will be searched", id: "anything else is optional" }, ];
example.title: example

properties.name: matches
properties.description: all options that match the search query

methods.name: search
methods.description: Opens the dropdown and filters the options
